file_type – The string key used to register the function.

gencap.globals.path_manager module

class gencap.globals.path_manager.DAICAPPathnamePolicyManager[source]

Bases: PathnamePolicyManager

DAICAP policy for structured dataset path generation.

Keywords:

  • “Patient”: Subject identifier.

  • “Series”: Series identifier.

  • “Label”: Label or annotation identifier.

  • “Sequence”: Sequence identifier.

class gencap.globals.path_manager.DefaultPathnamePolicyManager[source]

Bases: PathnamePolicyManager

Default policy for generating file paths.

Keywords:

  • “Index”: Used as the filename prefix.

class gencap.globals.path_manager.PathnamePolicyManager[source]

Bases: object

Base class for implementing pathname policies.

Subclasses must implement the _generate_dir_path and _generate_file_name methods to define how directories and filenames are generated based on provided keyword mappings.

supported_keywords

List of keywords supported by this policy for directory and filename generation.

Type:

list

class gencap.globals.path_manager.PathnamePolicyRegistry[source]

Bases: object

Registry and context manager for pathname policies.

This class allows registering multiple pathname policies and provides methods to retrieve policies, generate paths, and manage global pathname context.

_registry

Mapping of policy IDs to their corresponding PathnamePolicyManager instances.

Type:

dict

pathname_policy_id

Currently active policy ID.

Type:

str

pathname_policy_dict

Mapping of policy keywords to field names or constants.

Type:

dict

root_dir

Root directory for path generation.

Type:

str

get_filename(keyword_dict: dict, suffix: str, pathname_policy_id: str = None, root_dir: str = None, make_subdir: bool = True) → str[source]

Generate a full file path based on the selected pathname policy.

Parameters:

  • keyword_dict (dict) – Mapping of keywords to their values (e.g., {“Patient”: “001”}).

  • suffix (str) – File suffix or extension (e.g., .nii, .csv).

  • pathname_policy_id (str, optional) – ID of the pathname policy to use. Defaults to the current context.

  • root_dir (str, optional) – Root directory for path generation. Defaults to context root_dir.

  • make_subdir (bool) – If True, creates missing directories for the generated path.

Returns:

Full file path combining root directory, generated directory, and filename.

Return type:

str

Raises:

RuntimeError – If directory or filename generation fails.

get_keywords(pathname_policy_id: str)[source]

Get the list of supported keywords for a registered pathname policy.

Parameters:

pathname_policy_id (str) – The ID of the registered pathname policy.

Returns:

List of supported keywords defined by the policy.

Return type:

list

get_policies() → Dict[str, PathnamePolicyManager][source]

Retrieve all registered pathname policies.

Returns:

Mapping of policy IDs to policy instances.

Return type:

dict

register(pathname_policy_id: str)[source]

Register a new pathname policy class with a given identifier.

Parameters:

pathname_policy_id (str) – Unique identifier for the policy.

Returns:

A decorator that registers the policy class.

Return type:

Callable

Raises:

ValueError – If a policy with the same ID is already registered.

gencap.globals.pipeline_registry module

class gencap.globals.pipeline_registry.PipelineRegistry[source]

Bases: object

Registry for managing pipeline metadata and cached pipeline configurations.

This class maintains a centralized registry of available pipelines, stored in a local JSON file cache. It supports registering new pipelines, removing outdated ones, loading pipeline metadata, and describing pipeline details.

registry_file_path

File path to the pipeline registry JSON cache.

Type:

str

_registry

In-memory mapping of pipeline IDs to their metadata and file paths.

Type:

dict

Notes

  • Cached pipelines are automatically synchronized with JSON files stored in the pipelines directory.

  • The registry persists across sessions by saving its state in pipeline_registry.json.

get_description(pipeline_id: str)[source]

Print a human-readable description of a registered pipeline.

The description includes:

  • Pipeline information text (if available)

  • Task alias IDs with associated task unique IDs and versions

Parameters:

pipeline_id (str) – ID of the pipeline to describe.

Raises:

ValueError – If the pipeline ID is not registered.

get_pipelines() → list[source]

Retrieve a list of registered pipeline IDs.

Returns:

List of registered pipeline IDs.

Return type:

list

load_pipeline(pipeline_id: str) → dict[source]

Load pipeline metadata for a registered pipeline.

Parameters:

pipeline_id (str) – ID of the pipeline to load.

Returns:

The pipeline JSON metadata.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

ValueError – If the pipeline is not registered.

register(json_path: str, pipeline_id: str = None, force_replacement: bool = False)[source]

Register a new pipeline in the registry.

Parameters:

  • json_path (str) – Path to the pipeline JSON file to register.

  • pipeline_id (str, optional) – Explicit pipeline ID to register. If None, reads from the JSON file.

  • force_replacement (bool) – If True, overwrite an existing pipeline with the same ID.

Raises:

ValueError –

  • If the pipeline file is invalid or missing required keys. * If the pipeline already exists and force_replacement is False.

remove(pipeline_id: str)[source]

Remove a pipeline from the registry.

Parameters:

pipeline_id (str) – The ID of the pipeline to remove.

Raises:

ValueError – If the specified pipeline is not found in the registry.

gencap.globals.task_manager module

class gencap.globals.task_manager.TaskRegistry[source]

Bases: object

Registry for managing task classes and their versions.

This class allows registration, retrieval, and instantiation of tasks. It also supports grouping tasks by ID, retrieving available versions, and loading built-in tasks automatically.

_registry

Dictionary mapping (task_id, version) pairs to task classes.

Type:

Dict[Tuple[str, str], Task]

_grouped_registry

Dictionary grouping task IDs with their available versions.

Type:

Dict[str, List[str]]

create(task_id: str, version: str = None)[source]

Create an instance of a registered task.

Parameters:

  • task_id (str) – The unique task identifier.

  • version (str, optional) – Task version. If None, the latest version will be used.

Returns:

An instantiated task object.

Return type:

Task

Raises:

ValueError –

  • If the task is not registered. - If the specified version does not exist.

get_description(task_id: str)[source]

Print a detailed description of a registered task.

The description includes:

  • Task description text

  • Fields information (mandatory/optional input/output fields)

  • Parameter details

Parameters:

task_id (str) – Unique task identifier.

Raises:

ValueError – If the task ID is not registered.

get_tasks(show_version=True)[source]

Retrieve all registered tasks.

Parameters:

show_version (bool) – If True, return tasks with their versions grouped. If False, return only task IDs.

Returns:

Grouped task versions or a list of task IDs.

Return type:

Union[Dict[str, List[str]], List[str]]

get_versions(task_id: str)[source]

Retrieve all available versions of a specific task.

Parameters:

task_id (str) – Unique task identifier.

Returns:

Sorted list of available versions.

Return type:

List[str]

Raises:

KeyError – If the task is not registered.

register(task_id: str, version: str)[source]

Register a new task class in the registry.

This is used as a decorator for task classes. It verifies that the unique_id and version attributes of the class instance match the provided arguments.

Parameters:

  • task_id (str) – Unique identifier of the task.

  • version (str) – Version string of the task.

Returns:

A decorator function for registering the task.

Return type:

Callable

Raises:

ValueError –

  • If task_id does not match the class’s unique_id. - If version does not match the class’s version. - If the task with the same ID and version is already registered (except for predefined examples).

supports(task_id: str, version: str) → bool[source]

Check if a task with a specific ID and version is registered.

Parameters:

  • task_id (str) – Unique task identifier.

  • version (str) – Version string.

Returns:

True if supported, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool
